intro: Cicendiola filiformis, commonly known as the slender cicendia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, thread-like leaves and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Due to its unique appearance and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
